content: I think you might have missed this: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/748530848470663208/777675231060951100

author: emansipater
content: In short, with the DSWC you can set a permanent withdraw address before you deposit, making the deposit fully trustless

author: emansipater
content: That doesn't allow *programmatic* initiation of staking, but since you need someone to supply the validator key at the minimum anyways, one-time signing a message with a BLS withdrawal key doesn't really add any restrictions that I can see.

author: emansipater
content: The main difference is just that it makes a deposit into a two-step process instead of the theoretical minimum of being able to just directly specify the contract in the deposit directly (which would be nice but not a backwards-compatible method for those who have already deposited)

author: emansipater
content: But supporting trustless pools is the whole purpose of the is_final bit

author: emansipater
content: In terms of authenticating the withdrawal, I updated the proposal to suggest that we specify the sender of the eventual withdrawal will be the DSWC address.  So you just need to log that in the contract when it receives money, and it will be able to distinguish between money sent from somewhere else and/or just "appeared" via selfdestruct

author: emansipater
content: This is compatible with either a push or pull design for the actual send itself.
